author: Special Correspondent
text:
One of the cars which were involved in an accident near Manamadurai in Sivaganga district on Saturday, killing two persons.

K. Rajmohan, paediatrician, Government District Headquarters Hospital in Ramanathapuram, and a tourist from Kerala were killed and three others injured when the cars in which they were travelling, collided at Somanathapuram milk gate near here on Saturday.

Police said that Dr. Rajmohan was proceeding to Ramanathapuram from Madurai with his wife Vasanthakumari (36), doing MS at Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH), Madurai, and son Sidharth (11) when the accident occurred.

He died on the spot and his wife, who suffered a fracture in a leg and cut injuries on the forehead, was admitted to the GRH. Sidharth and M. Suresh (30), who was at the wheel, suffered minor injuries, the police said.

Jafique (30) from Mallapuram district in Kerala, who was on his way to Munnar after visiting Erwadi Dargah in the other car, died on the spot after the collision, the police said.

Two others from Mallapuram, who were travelling in the car – M. Ajis (28) and M. Farook, who was driving the car – suffered minor injuries.

Dr. Rajmohan had been working at Government District Headquarters Hospital for about a year, Hospital Superintendent K. Krishnamoorthy said.

Earlier, he had worked at Kilakarai Government Hospital, he added.

Dr. Rajmohan was an active member of District Heritage Club. Along with V. Rajaguru, a schoolteacher and an archaeological aficionado, Dr. Rajmohan had collected artefacts from two villages near Uthirakosamangai in August last year which threw light on the possible existence of trade between the Pandyas of the Sangam Age and the Romans and the Chinese.
title: Doctor, tourist from Kerala killed in accident
